oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Gillette Safety Razor Co. Box
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This box contained 10 12 blade packets of Gillettes Safety Blades. Printed on the bottom is a notice that lays out restrictions concerning the use of the blades. Safety blades were first offered for sale in 1903 and their use by the US military in WWI exposed millions of American men to the product for the first time. This pack was issued to James McFerren Johnston during the war. He served in HQ Co., Ord. Corps, attached to the 114th MG Battn., 30th Div.
